result.execSummary:
The defendant Coll J. Fox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The forfeiture and costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning August 15, 2022 with payments increasing to $50.00 a month beginning September 15, 2022.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Coll J. Fox

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

9:35 AM Defendant Coll J. Fox in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Coll J. Fox. Victim notification has been complied. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend to county ordinance of disorderly conduct.  Plea of no contest.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders a $263.50 forfeiture and $67.00 victim witness surcharge.  The costs shall be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning August 15, 2022 with payments increasing to $50.00 a month beginning September 15, 2022.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Coll J. Fox
Current: 509 Lemke Avenue, Medford, WI 54451 United States  (Effective: 07-05-2022)
Prior: N8317 Newood Avenue, Rib Lake, WI 54470
Status hearing on September 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

1:11 PM Defendant Coll J. Fox in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas Grant Smith in court for Coll J. Fox. Victim notification has been complied. Waives further reading of the complaint, charges and penalties. Plea of not guilty entered,  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Within 72 hours, defendant is to notify the Clerk of Court's office with his current address and telephone number.  The sheriff's department shall assist the defendant in retrieving his personal property.

9:17 am  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Coll J. Fox appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for the arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Victim notification complied.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $500.00 signature bond with booking.  Court orders a $500.00 signature bond with booking.  Defendant shall notify the clerk's office within 72 hours of being released of his current address.  Law enforcement shall assist the defendant in retrieving his personal property.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Notice was given to defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
